title: Authors and Citation

what: High dimensional mediation analysis with confounding adjustment
title: High dimensional mediation analysis with confounding adjustment
text: goal mydemo implement high dimensional mediation analysis confounding adjustment.

title: High dimensional mediation analysis with confounding adjustment
text: can install development version mydemo like :

title: High dimensional mediation analysis with confounding adjustment
code: library(mydemo) dat <- sim_data(n = 300, p = 2000) X <- dat$X Y <- dat$Y M <- dat$M COV <- dat$COV

title: High dimensional mediation analysis. — himaconf
text: High dimensional mediation analysis confounding adjustment. Methods confounding adjustment include regression adjustment, propensity score adjustment, inverse probability weighting, overlapping weighting.

title: High dimensional mediation analysis. — himaconf
code: himaconf(   X,   M,   Y,   COV,   k = 2,   CONFmethod = c("RA", "PS", "IPW", "OW"),   MTmethod = c("HIMA", "HIMA2"),   tips = TRUE,   simplify = TRUE )

title: High dimensional mediation analysis. — himaconf
text: X Binary exposure. M High dimensional mediators. Y Continuous outcome. COV Covariates, also called confounders. k SIS parameter. CONFmethod Method confounding adjustments, including RA,PS,IPW,OW. MTmethod Method mediation testing, including HIMA, HIMA2. tips Whether output message. simplify output mediator p value less 0.05.

title: High dimensional mediation analysis. — himaconf
text: dataframe contain mediators' point estimate p value.

title: Generate simulated data. — sim_data
text: n Sample size. p Dimension mediator. r Covariance M's error. alpha1.8 Coefficients alpha 1st-8th mediator. beta1.8 Coefficients beta 1st-8th mediator.

title: Generate simulated data. — sim_data
text: list contain X, M, Y, Cov.

title: Generate simulated data. — sim_data
code: library(mydemo) dat <- sim_data(n = 500) X <- dat$X Y <- dat$Y M <- dat$M COV <- dat$COV
